user_review: Ended up here after searching for hours on where to get decent Italian in Montreal. Was not disappointed.Ordered the classic spaghetti with meat sauce and it really hit home for me. The bread was also very delicious. Unfortunately I didn't take any pics of my food like a good Yelper is supposed to, but I will definitely be back to this place!Very charming place too, with old fashioned decor. I believe they have a salad bar as well that was free with a pasta dinner. (Though my memory may be incorrect)

We went here for lunch. I ordered the linguini with lobster and it was very tasty.  However, my daughter had hands down the best dish at our table  risotto with chicken and mushrooms. Just one taste made you want to beg for more!!   Three of us ordered sangria which was very refreshing.  It made me think of Summer.   After lunch, my hubby had an espresso while I enjoyed a cafe au lait decaf. Unfortunately my daughter's dish was just a special of the day, so they don't always have it. She even sent her compliments back to the chef.    Our waiter was very helpful, funny and kind.  We would definitely go back there when we visit Montreal again.

Great little place near Bon Secours marketplace in old Montreal.  Our concern was that they would not have egg free pasta (dt allergies), but they did!The hostess and waitress was extremely helpful.  They even have a salad bar as part of their restaurant with each order.  This was also very good.Cool ambiance and good food.  If you find yourself in this touristy area this is a great place to stop and grab a bite

very beautiful restaurant in the heart of the old port! the portions are generous and the food was good! prices are reasonable. the only thing is that the pasta i took (prosciutto with blue cheese) didn't really have prosciutto and blue cheese. the sauce was milky (not cheesy) and i had maybe to tiny pieces of prosciutto.
Amazing selection of comfort food. I ordered a dish with lobster and cream. It was to die for! You also get to start with the salad bar and they offer and excellent selection of wines.

This spot is great for families, it kinda reminded me of an Olive Garden but with better food. Service was okay, and considering the restaurant was empty for a Friday night - they did'nt need to stick us in the back of the place. The food was all very average, my favorite was probably the pasta with shrimp. Everything else was kinda meh. I probably wouldn't come back here considering Montreal has amazing options. Keep Eating, Angela
The duck confit is spectacular. The pasta accompanied with this dish is extremely boring. I suggest asking for a substitution with another pasta dish.

Nice restaurant in Montreal's Old Port. Prices are reasonable : main dishes (all containing some form of pasta) range from 12$ to 29$, the most expensive being the lobster linguini. Meals come with free bread and all-you-can-eat salad bar. Service is prompt and friendly. They don't have a terrace and the interior is quite dark, but it is tastefully decorated and has a quaint historical feel to it.

Everything was fresh and made to order except the tomato sauce, ofcourse. I ordered a red wine sangria, which was fantastic and refreshing, and goat cheese and sundried tomato ravioli and it was very good as well except the sauce which was too tart for my taste. Liked the ambiance and really friendly staff which helped me decide my order as a vegetarian :)

Oh yeah... yumm!   We were on a mission for lobster... Walked over from Rue de Catherine- quick, cute easy stroll to the port. And without reservation (not sure they take them), walked in and got seated right away.  Hostess was cool, sweet, and super efficient.  Everything on the menu looked good- true to mission- ordered the  lobster with pesto spaghetti- Very tasty.  Meal and includes salad bar!  The execution on the food was not a luscious 5 star meal , but the overall experience was a strong 4.  Wine selection was sufficient.  Service was casual but professional , food was solid.   Felt like a super great deal.

Was strolling through Old Montreal and had a sudden craving for pasta so we decided to try this place. I got the lobster linguine while my boyfriend got the lamb chop spaghetti. First of all, the portions here were huge! The linguine was delicious and had a good amount of lobster in it. However, I found it a bit strange that they used peas in this dish and would have preferred spinach or onions. It just tasted a little off. My boyfriend said he enjoyed the lamb pasta as well. The salad bar was quite simple but fresh. Service was also great. Would recommend if you're looking for quick service and yummy pasta.

Such delicious simple pasta for such an affordable price with all you can eat salad bar and bread with garlic butter!!! Super Fancy French food is good and all but I have to say nothing beats a plate of perfectly made spaghetti! I had the white sangria which was absolutely delicious - you could definitely tell that the wine was marinated with the fruits for a good amount of time before being served.One thing to note is that extra melted/baked mozzarella cheese on the dish is an extra $4 which we weren't aware of, but I would highly recommend it as it was so good. Couldn't have asked for a more satisfying meal!! :D

What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said.  It's amazing! Definitely on my list of place to hit again when I come back.  The pasta and chicken was delicious!  The salad bar was so fresh and really felt like something your grandma would make and set out on the table before dinner.  The prices are really fair for what you get.  We beat the rush and had a cute little table in the corner. Definitely bookmark this place and check them out!

I really really wanted shrimp & pasta, and though it wasn't on the menu the server helped me combine two dishes to create my own, which was lovely! I wish they'd addmore seafood options (can't have meat due to halal restrictions) or add a halal option - that would be awesome. Overall a great place! We got cheesy garlic bread, shrimp (15 pieces of shrimp) and my huge dish of pasta all for 31$. All you can eat salad bar plus bread&butter to start with. The two of us were pretty full!

This restaurant had been recommended by a friend and it sure did not disappoint! It was the perfect place to enjoy a great meal in the charming Old Montreal area. The space is very quaint with stone walls, wood floors, and dim lighting. The staff was friendly but they seemed extremely busy and maybe short handed. There was a line waiting to get in, which did not end up taking too long. No one was really taking names or anything which was a bit confusing. The waitress was prompt, friendly, and accurate which was appreciated. Our French was very rusty and she was more than happy to speak English to us. While you wait for you food, they bring a nice bread basket with a garlic butter side. A salad bar is included with most meals, but the choices are pretty limited. Keep that in mind if you are wanting more of a substantial salad. I ordered a vegetarian spaghetti dish that was absolutely yummy. My travel companion had an eggplant dish that he thought was delicious. The house red wine was great and a good value as well. The entire meal was very affordable considering the area. I can't speak for how the desserts tasted, but they looked amazing. All in all, if you are looking for a cute and cozy place for some Italian food in Old Montreal, I would suggest you check this place out. It is not pretentious or flashy, just a great place to enjoy a good meal and unwind.  bon appétit

While walking through Old Montreal with some locals, they suggested this restaurant. It definitely lived up to expectations! The menu is quite large and offers a broad range of different pastas and sauces. According to our waitress, the recipes have stayed the same for a long time, which speaks to the longevity of this restaurant in the Old Montreal area.Upon finally deciding what I'd eat (I went with the classic spaghetti with meat sauce, as they call it, the "Spaghetti St-Leonard") which cost $14. All the menu prices seemed very reasonable, especially considering that all menu items come with salad bar and bread included. The bread comes out warm and fresh, and is served with a delicious garlic butter, made in house, as well as conventional butter. The salad bar isn't huge, but it has a good range of different salads that include leafy greens, pasta or potato salads, and other marinated salads and cut-up vegetables. The dressings are very tasty, and there is a vinaigrette that is a real stand-out. The quality of the main course was also great. The pasta was cooked just perfectly (not too hard and not too soft), and the sauce was flavourful and satisfying. The portion size was also surprisingly large, so I wouldn't think anyone would leave hungry.As an interesting side note, the menu items are all named after places and figures from the local area, so those new to the area or just visiting can find some names to google while they wait for their meal (the menus are left behind as placemats).Also, the decor in this place is really nice and rustic, which suits the Old Montreal charm perfectly. This place is definitely worth a try.

The four of us stopped here after a walking tour of Montreal and were all very hungry. We were definitely not disappointed! The servers were polite and attentive and the atmosphere was cozy and casual. I ordered the chicken parm with added mixed vegetables and thought it was delicious! My family also ordered pasta dishes and said they were satisfying and yummy. Before our meals arrived, the server told us we could stop by the salad bar. The salad bar was clean, and had healthy and yummy options. we were also given fresh bread with garlic butter and regular butter. The garlic butter was literally to die for!!

The bad:Won't allow seating until the entire party is here. Lobster linguine has no flavor and I had to add lots of salt and pepper.The salad bar is very basic and disappointing. Sangria has very little flavor.Escargot is so-soThe good:duck is a bit sweet and very tender. I like the joyous Atmosphere and interior decor.

I adore this location. It's perfectly situated in Vieux-Montréal and cures any pasta craving you may have. I ordered a white sangria to drink, the Golden Square Mile pasta, followed by the Tiramisu for dessert. All fantastic, highly recommend. Upon entering this location you will be politely greeted and showed to your table where the server will explain that you can order wine and pour yourself a glass located at the salad bar, and you can also help yourself to the salads (buffet style), then you are brought a basket of breads directly to the table to enjoy. None of which we were expecting but nonetheless was a pleasant surprise.Our server was polite but a bit quiet, we believe she was dealing with an agitated customer right next to us so her demeanour may have been lacking. Overall, great place for families and couples. Amazing wine selection and the food is outstanding.

So what to do for dinner in our first night in a new city...We were in the mood for Italian while in Montreal. This restaurant was relatively close to our hotel so we decided to walk there. Unfortunately for us, the city was under an extreme cold alert, so the 20 minute walk became an exercise in survival. Thankfully, once we were there, we quickly forgot about the cold. We were promptly seated and the restaurant was fairly busy so we were glad to have a table right away. Place is a little quaint and has a nice European decor. It's located in the Old Montreal area. They bring you a complementary bread with an amazing garlic butter along with the AYCE salad bar. We quickly decided to go with the Cheese Garlic bread for an appetizer. We went with Spaghetti St-Paul (spicy tomato sauce), Rigatoni with meat sauce, smoked meat and mozzarella and Spaghetti with meat sauce and meatballs.The service was attentive and prompt as we were never out of water. Portions size were decent and all 3 dishes were flavourful. We were glad that we braved the weather to be here. Recommended.

Cozy atmosphere, clean, great service,  excellent spaghetti, large plates with salad bar included. Good value for the main tourist area. Wish we would have eaten here again instead of trying the close-by poutine restaurant the next day, which was awful.I had the spaghetti St. Paul, which was the perfect level of spice with mushrooms added.  If you like mushrooms,  I highly recommend adding them to your pasta dish.
Best Spaghetti place in old Montréal. Good service and delicious food. Atmosphere was nice too

Were looking for a restaurant that had decent choice of pasta right before we go to see the fireworks. Roamed around a few blocks around old Montreal and finally settled on this place just because they stated they make their own pasta and had a variety of choices plus the place was almost full We ordered a bruschetta and a dish of spaghetti with vegetables. Food - portion are pretty big for Canadian standard but taste was ok. Nothing that was anything to remember. Service - waitress was friendly and accommodating to our vegetarian optionsAmbience - simple 2 floor buildingWas a little disappointed in taste as I was expecting more from fresh pasta and sauce.

Took the family here on a beautiful spring evening for dinner. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming. Servers were very polite, and were great with our children. I quote my 10-yr old: "OMG! This is the BEST TORTELLINI EVER!!!!!!!"I had Les 100 Cloches, which was delicious and tender. Everyone enjoyed themselves, and we were very pleased with our choice for dinner!
Fantastic place. Coming here for years never fails to deliver great meals, service at a very good price. Located in Old Montreal. Don't miss it.
Everything was excellent. Had the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti, and escargot. Lovely atmosphere

The pasta here is simple and elegant, making the basics to the perfection. The price is very reasonable for the quality of food you will be getting.Service is fast and excellent thanks to their friendly staff and of course the attentive chefs and cooks in the kitchen.Highly recommend for those just want some spaghetti gastronomy.

Very welcoming, about a 5 minute wait to be seated. The decor is rustic but tasteful. Our waitress took us to the back room which has a story  of its own. Charles dickens wrote the notes for a tale of two cities in this room. The waitress was very polite and was able to switch between French and English very easily.  We ordered and our food came within 20 minutes, the people in my group ordered - #1 Le Golden Square Mile, #2 Le Bonaventure,  #3 Raviolis Le Windsor, #14 Spaghetti Place - D'Armes, #20 Le Jean talon.All of them where very good and we all rated our dishes a 10/10. They had a complementary salad bar and it was very fresh. Over all an amazing meal, would definitely come back!

I had heard many good things about this place and so I was looking forward to trying it for myself.  We went on a Friday night and while there was a bit of a lineup, we didnt wait too long to be seated. Service was friendly and quick but the location itself was a little dark and a little cramped. The prices are very very affordable and the quantity you get is very generous , you also get bread with garlic butter on the side and access to the unlimited salad bar with the purchase of any main meal which is a nice touch. The salad bar is okay, it has a few different options but nothing really standout.  we had the braised lamb with herbed pasta which was pretty good when you mix the sauce from the lamb with the pasta, it had nice flavour , although the lamb wasnt as moist as you would expect it to be even though it is braised. We also had the salmon pasta which actually had zero flavour , it almost tasted like KD with a little flavourless salmon inside. We had to add alot of salt and alot of parm in order to give it some sort of taste.  The house red wine was really cheap and actually very good so no complaints there. This seemed like a very family friendly place and a good idea for a casual inexpensive dinner. Not my favourite pasta place in Montreal but it wasnt a bad experience either, so I wouldnt discourage anyone for trying it out for themselves !

A nice spot to have dinner at old port, reasonably priced for the location and homely meals.The atmosphere is cozy and the service is pretty relaxed so you can enjoy yourself. Apparently this place has been around for a VERY long time, so kudos for them!Their menu is mostly pasta based, I got the stuffed manicotti and spaghetti bolognese duo. (the entrees are all named after montreal streets or areas, mine was st.denis something) Pasta was really good, cooked just right. Nothing too fancy and just hits the spot. They have a serve yourself salad bar, with about 6 different salads. The salads weren't particularly appealing but hey, eat your veggies right? They also start you off with rolls served with garlic butter. The rolls were okay but wow that garlic butter! My boyfriend nearly finished off the whole thing. Worth a try if you're looking for a place to eat in old montreal. side story: we spoke to another diner who just exited the restaurant and took a photo of the storefront. Turns out he sailed for 4 months from the Netherlands, making stops along the shore at every city he passed. He said the lobster linguine was good!

We had to wait 25 minutes in line for a table, it was worth it.Ambient lighting, an excellent all you can eat salad bar.They have a nice wine bottle list.Devine lamb shank braised in red wine that just fell apart and the fettuccine was to die for, nice seasoning and doneness. I will come again.

This place was recommended by a local while walking on the street. The dishes were all well cooked nothing burnt. All though the bread was cold.  Left the seafood place across the street. Server was extremely rude. Had a very stinky attitude.

I would give this a 3.5 if I could - 4 for food, 3 for service. The restaurant is cute, and the meals were very good. Bread and garlic butter were provided, which was a nice little touch. I got the eggplant and my husband got a pesto dish with lamb. Both were delicious! I wish we would've stopped after the meals because I probably would've given this a solid 4, maybe considered even higher, but we decided to stay for dessert. I got the tiramisu, and was disappointed. It wasn't bad, but was lacking on the coffee flavor and really just tasted more like vanilla cake with whipped cream. It was a very light, nice vanilla cake, but not what I was looking forward to in a tiramisu. We also had to wait a very long time (15-20 mins) after we had clearly finished dessert before the waitress brought our check and we could leave. It got a little busier and there was only one waitress, so we were patient, but it was a very long wait with no water refills or anything while she passed us multiple times. This might have been overlooked if she was a great waitress to begin with, but even before this, the service was only okay so it was a little bit annoying. Again, I understood she was busy, but we saw tables order and get their food between the time she brought us the check and came back by to run the card.Overall, the food was good and is why I gave this a 4 star review. Not a fancy place, but a very nice dinner. The service is good when the restaurant is very slow, but could get frustrating during busier dinner hours.

We couldn't be any happier. We had to wait for a good 40 minutes before we could be seated, but it was definitely worth it. The staff are super friendly and very efficient. The portion sizes are generous. The food was evidently fresh. Highly recommended. Thank me later!
Pasta definitely tastes fresh, garlic butter for the bread was really good, cheese tortellini with rosé wine sauce was DELICIOUS!!

This restaurant is amazing! My family and I were visiting from the states and wanted some pasta for dinner. We walked about a mile to find it from our hotel and I am very glad we did! The staff speaks both French and English and we easily understood the menu as it was in both languages. The salad bar was great and there menu is diverse enough for even the most picky eaters! Definitely give it a try!

Pros: had a salad bar that comes with your lunch but because there weren't a lot of customers the veggies seemed like it was sitting out for a while. Cons: We ordered 3 dishes the arrabiata (spicy marinara) spaghetti, pesto lamb pasta, and the baked rigatoni with meat sauce. All the sauces were way too sweet and tasted like it was straight out of a can. The pesto with lamb was awful and gamey which smelled strange. The pesto sauce lacked flavor and depth. Service: Just after ordering 3 dishes I realized it would be too much food so quickly asked to cancel 1 item. The waitress was upset and said if I cancel a dish only 1 person could have the salad bar even though we were ordering 2 entrees and an appetizer. It didn't make any sense and they were clearly desperate to make money off of anyone. Service went downhill after that and she never refilled our water cups or came back to ask if we needed anything else.

Found this by accident, great find in historic Montreal. We have been there twice because the wait staff is excellent, the Wine selection is excellent. We all found the food to be better than OK but not exceptional.We will for sure be back for the wine and the service! Bon!
Amazing food, there's always a wait, but it's 100% worth it. Great food, ambiance is wonderful, and the history of Dickens is worth it!

Really beautiful place. Came here for a staff Christmas dinner in December and the decorations were stunning. The food and the service were also very good. Overall good experience and they easily accommodate big groups.

We waited in a long line for dinner basing our decision on the positive reviews (about forty minutes). Someone walked by and commented 'Wow, look at the long line! This place must be good'. That was our thinking too but looks were deceiving. The restaurant seemed understaffed. The hostess was our waitress and also the bartender. I ordered the pasta arrabbiata since this is a difficult pasta to mess up. However, I was dead wrong. The pasta was overcooked and cold. The tomato sauce was thick chunks directly from the can. And the oil? Well, let's just say everything was swimming in it like a fish in the St. Lawrence River.

Very good food, service, and atmosphere!! Located in a very historic part of town. I felt like I was transported back in time. Restaurant is known as the place where Charles Dickens, in May of 1842, wrote notes for what would become A Tale of two Cities.

Awesome Italian restaurant in downtown Montreal! We went on a Sunday night for dinner, and we had such an awesome time. It was peaceful, and I loved how the interior was decorated with Christmas decorations. We got the lobster linguine, which was absolutely delicious. The noodles were cooked just right and was super chewy, and the sauce wasn't too salty. They also give you a decent amount of lobster meat in the pasta. We also ordered the rose tortellini with melted cheese and the lamb with pesto sauce. The only disappointing dish was the lamb with pesto. The sauce and the lamb tasted sour. They also have bread with garlic bread, and all you can eat salad. The salad bar wasn't super diverse, but the vegetables were fresh and everything went well with the food. Also, I highly recommend the white sangria! It's super sweet and tasty! (Although I wish they had put more alcohol in it). The staff was super nice and sweet. I highly recommend this Italian restaurant.

There are endless options for Italian food in and around Montreal, so deciding upon a place is a bit like trying to select a beer in Munich during Octoberfest. Needless to say, this place did not disappoint! The portions were generous, the service attentive, and each entree comes with free salad bar access. I settled on a plate of spaghetti with a spicy tomato sauce (arrabiata), and it was as expertly prepared and delicious as you could get. Even better, my order only came to $11.00 (Canadian dollars) after tax. If you're in Montreal and looking for pasta, definitely give this place a shot!

I would give it 3.5 if I could only because their garlic butter was really good! Service is quick, all you can eat salad and bread, the buns are cold and there are 5/6 salads to choose from. Pasta was mediocre, the vegetable pasta did not have enough sauce (number 7), the daisy pasta (number 1) was too heavy, they stuffed the ravioli with cheese and then put more cheese on top, probably would be better with a brown butter sauce. We were just desperate for food, would not come again.

This is a pretty good spot if you're in old Montreal and by that i mean one of the only places you don't need reservations for on Saturday night ! My husband and i could not find a restaurant with any tables so we were so relieved to find that they don't need reservations. Only had to wait 15-20 min while they were packed. Waitresses were super nice. Biggest disappointment was the food. The salad bar was a bit of a shock, just lettuce and dressing, unless you like mayo based pasta salads. My husband had a creamy salmon pasta that was super watery. My sundries tomato and goat cheese ravioli were really good, once i got all the oil off of them. I think because it was almost 9pm might have been why it seemed rushed together. My sangria was amazing. But it's a decent restaurant if you're looking for something without reservations.

Good past overall could have stronger seasoningFree salad bar which is actually good and we ordered a merlot bottle for 35dlls and ended up paying 80 dlls for the whole dinner which we thiught was very reasonable for what we got.
In general i wasn't impressed with food in Monteral . Thisbplace has a decent salad bar and pasta. Thier steak is better than thier chicken. Service was good .place was clean

The menu has many different options that are all unique. Next, the inside of the restaurant is very cozy and original. The service was amazing, friendly, and fast. I very much enjoyed the bread with the garlic butter. Also, the salad bar is a great concept with the best salad dressings I've had. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

The title had me thinking this would be a bit pedestrian, but as soon as we were greeting we loved the place.  Our waitress was the best on our whole trip - casual and genuine.  The food was very good.  The wine I ordered had gone bad, but the waitress tried some, agreed, and had no problem getting a replacement bottle.

An amazing place in Old Montreal to be greeted by the owner more often than not. You will enjoy the all you can eat salad and soup before your main course arrives. Choosing the Spaghetti and meat sauce is a wise choice. Enjoy the garlic butter on the fresh buns served up with it too. I highly recommend this location and food here. It's reasonably priced. I'll be back.

Cozy place, and lovely ambiance. It's located downtown Montreal. Getting there was really nice walk around the city. The food was amazing! I would like to add that they have fresh salad buffet and that is all you can eat when you order food, I had their pesto salmon and I remember it's $17 plus tax. Highly recommended place! You should check it out when you're in Montreal and craving good Italian food! Xx
It was the only place I could find that was open for a 6pm dinner and it was a great option! I wondered Lamb and it was cooked perfectly. The meals included a salad bar that I wasn't expecting.
This place is amazing and so is the food. Staff are kind and approachable. I love how it the restaurant looks inside; clean, open space (not crowded), vintage and it gives you a welcoming vibe.

Well all-spaghetti all delicious! Very warm, homey, relaxing vibe. Perfect lighting and pleasant music. Nice and polite staff. Well priced menu. I tried the Grand Prix. Liked it. Yummy and plenty. The salad bar is included. But it does not have much to offer. I would definitely order dessert but I was already full. The interesting point is that they serve daily wine. A glass of red (Spain's) went really well with the food. Spicy and dry.

Tried this place with the family, they have a kids menu with different options and they had no issue picking something. Between $8 and $12 so it's not that cheap but kids enjoyed their meals.For the adults we were all very happy. The spaghetti sauce is great, reminded me of when people took hours to make a batch instead of buying Classico sauce. The meatballa were huge and perfect in every way. My wife took the eggplant lasagna and loved it.Bread and garlic butter on the table prior to ordering, salad and soup bar with limited options but everything seemed fresh and the homemade (?) salad dressing was very good. We were all too full to order dessert but they still brought some chocolatey squares with the bill.Service was fast and overall I have nothing negative to say.I spaghetti felt like dried pasta instead of fresh pasta like one would expect at that price point, it is my only negative point.Will return if we are back in the area.

Walked into this restaurant while we were walking around old town. There were seven of us. Service was good. Very friendly server. We all ordered differently. Wife was happy they had gluten free selection. Good wine selections. Everybody was happy with the food.  My gripe is the sambuca was served without coffee beans
Our first trip to Montreal, what a great place for Italian food.  Our server was so nice and helpful

This is an incredible deal in old Montreal. Wish we'd discovered it 2 days ago. We stopped in because it was close to our marina (traveling by boat) and it was rainy so didn't want to search. Cozy old world atmosphere. Almost immediately, were served rolls with butter that had a good amount of fresh garlic added--good. I ordered lamb shank, husband ordered arrabiata. Then we were told our meals also included an incredible salad buffet--potato, green, carrot salads, mixed greens with tangy mustard dressing, beets, green beans, and others I didn't try but all I did were tasty. Good glass of house wine only $7 Canadian. Servings were large--had leftovers. Bottom line: Food was very good, even though not amazing, but I'm giving 5 stars for value. Whole meal--including 2 hearty pasta entrees, salad bar, glass of wine, bottle of pellogrino was $55 Canadian for two--a steal.

I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. It is definitely a tourist restaurant but the food was pretty good. The salad bar and large portion sizes filled us up. The house wine was inexpensive and tasty.

What to say about this place! The pasta menu is very big, the wine selection as well. Prices a reasonable the old port.The decoration is beautiful and the ambiance is warm, except a bit loud.I took the "monsieur le maire drapeau" which consisted of tortellinis stuffed with ricotta cheese in a rosé sauce topped with melted mozzarella. The meal itself was very good. Sauce was very tasteful.  You get all you can eat small salad bar and fresh bread.The garlic butter was AMAZING. I was filled with pasta and i still ate some bread with it.Service was ok. She took my bread plate when i wasn't done.Overall delicious experience.

Good, but not at all great. It's spaghetti. Their spaghetti tastes exactly like you or I would make in 5 minutes. The meatballs were pretty bland, but not bad. Very popular due to its excellent location. Great staff.

Excellent food and a great atmosphere. It is located in a 300 year old building and has a really cool vibe. They have a large wine selection. Each meal comes with a salad and soup bar that is phenomenal. The chicken Parmesan and meatballs are great. The waitress was quick and attentive. We will definitely visit again when we are in the area.
Food is good, although service needs improvement. They provide all you can eat salad if you order a main course
Nice place! Great food and service, highly recommended. Great location and awesome historic building.

Old Montreal. Had a delicious authentic Italian meal. I had their house specialty: pasta w/meat sauce. Daughter had one of the specials: linguini with lobster sauce. Service was very good. Came with salad bar, bread, and garlic butter. Their cheesecake was some of the finest I've had. Lemon cake was also delicious. Strong recommend for this place.

Went here on a date with my wife while on vacation. Located in Old Montreal, the restaurant isn't very large, but felt cozy, with a few other diners sitting nearby. Perfect ambiance to have great conversations with the people you're with. Food was great. Got the lamb with pesto spaghetti. Very good. They also bring out bread & butter before hand, also very good. Overall, really enjoyed my dining experience here.

Stopped here for lunch after a walking tour of Montreal.  I had the eggplant parmigiana special that included their salad bar and soup offering.  Both the food and service was excellent.  Highly recommended!

We wandered into this charming restaurant inside an historic building by chance.  Inside, we were greeted by a lovely young lady who was fluent in both English and French.  We were seated in a dining room featuring old stone and deeply polished wood, with golden lighting...a cozy ambiance!  Service was prompt, and our selections from the fairly extensive menu were all tasty and served fresh and piping hot.  The bread service and small salad bar were complimentary, and were also delicious.  My order of spaghetti with meat sauce was superb, while my companion's order of chicken parmigiana with marinara sauce and pasta was tender and juicy.  All prices were reasonable for a tourist area.  Overall, this was a lovely experience in an attractive restaurant.

I love finding places that give value!L'Usine de Saghetti's got the right mix, so here are your 1, 2, 3sAtmosphere: Warm! The entire place is draped in wood - floors, walls, tables, chairs... it feels like they've carved out the place from inside of a massive tree.  Small(isn) yet disruptively well spaced L'Usine is a great place to be on an intimate date or with a group of friends.Food: This is where the place comes up trumps - a great selection of freshly made pastas served with a basket of fresh bread and an open bar salad.  What's nice is that of the dishes I tried none where over-bearing or overly heavy, which leaves you with the opportunity to really savour the meal at hand.  Le Golden Square mile was my favourite choice - extremely well done.   Last, L'Usine has a great selection of wines - some of which are 'importation privée (ip) i.e. they have been exclusively procured for the L'Usine.  Points!  Prices range from $14-$18 per dish, and little more for the fancier varieties (with meats an such) - like I said, value!Service: the service here is good - nothing overly fancy, in fact the waitresses are quite casual about their work.  Not to say that they are slack or uninterested, but they are efficient and hardly noticeable otherwise.  Bring some of your A French game when you come - some waitress' communicate best in French here. mais ce n'est pas un problème - juste une autre occasion de pracitice la langue de Molière!Super great place to pop in for a date or gathering.  Will certainly be coming back.Eat well you all!

This is a go to spot for us in Montreal.  The value for what you get is unbeatable.  Escargots were excellent, chicken parm is very well done with light breading and lots of fresh tomato and basil.  Tomato sauce is awesome.  Perfect place for a nice dinner at prices that are cheaper than East Side Marios with actual quality food!
Was open on Christmas Day. Attentive service. Great food. 2 adults + 2 kids. The ravioli was fresh small salad bar that comes with entree. Good value for a family.

What wonderful service! It was a snowy day in the is beautiful town and we slipped in to this quaint restaurant and felt like we slipped back in time with excellent service and wonderful pastas in huge portions! To salad bar was a fun surprise and very very good with different sorts  of fresh mixed salads  The staff was so kind and attentive and we enjoyed such a delightful afternoon there as we leisurely ate our meal. Would highly recommend!
Great service, but we ordered the duck medium rare as per the chef's recommendation, and I threw up after dinner and the next morning.

user_city: Glen Cairn - Kanata South Business Park, Canada
user_review: Great restaurant with great atmosphere. We are a family of 5 and the food was delicious and affordable. Staff is fantastic and very welcoming.  Plan for a meal here and you are in the heart of old Montreal. We were very happy with our choice.

Had lunch here, mid week, mid winter. No wait, not crowded, good service. Meatballs were a bit oily but the cheesy garlic bread was delicious and the spaghetti was properly cooked. Good, solid lunch spot.

It was a bit difficult to choose from so many restaurant in that old town area. Was attracted by the decoration inside and went for the lobster spaghetti on the ad, which is Very delicious. Tasty bread and nice salad bar for free, too.

Beautiful restaurant in the old port of Montreal. A group of us had supper there on a weekend and it wasn't packed at all. The salad bar is a plus but isn't really something special. The garlic butter that came with the bread, though, was excellent. There is a lot of choice on the menu for people with different tastes. Different meat options, vegetarian options, different pastas... something for everyone! All of us enjoyed our meal and the bonus was that the prices were extremely reasonable compared to other restaurants in the area. Not the best pasta plate I've ever had but it was still very satisfying as I finished the whole thing (i had the linguini with prosciutto and blue cheese).

We were looking for something good on a budget. It seems that most restaurants in this area are pricey so when we found this on Yelp we decided to check it out. I got the lobster linguini special and my boyfriend got the steak and spaghetti. Both dishes were so rich and flavorful. The wait staff was friendly and the salad bar was a nice plus.

Its a nice cozy place with amiable staff. The food is good and service is great. It generally gets a long waiting line at the peak time. It has some vegetarian options too so loved it. Definitely recommend the place.
Our experience here was very nice.  The servers were warm and welcoming, and the sangria was excellent.  The food was very good as well!  Overall very good experience!Bon appetite!

Eat. Here.Eat too much here.Eat and drink everything including the salad bar here.I was introduced to this restaurant one blizzardy night almost 5 years ago as me and my friends sought refuge from the cold after a night of skating in old port.It was the best winter discovery of my life.Starting with the buns and "ohmygodthisissogood" homemade garlic butter (and yes you can ask for more but you will feel ashamed in your happiness), this restaurant really offers everything a pasta lover needs. The free salad bar is always stocked and always fresh. Their house vinaigrette is tangy and delicious and I put it on everything I pick from the salad bar, even if it's just the potato salad.I have tried nearly everything on their menu but I HIGHLY recommend the "place des armes" spaghetti with 2 HUGE succulent meatballs. Their meat pasta sauce is the perfect balance of tangy and sweet and the pasta is ALWAYS cooked to perfection. I'm an al-dente fanatic and l'Usine de Spaghetti delivers it perfectly every time.I have recommended this restaurant to every single person I meet who is in Montreal for the first time and every person that has eaten there has told me it was a great recommendation. The most recent people to hear me stand on a soap box and rave about this restaurant were a couple from Newfoundland I happened to overhear on a terrace (I'm originally from the East Coast) and after I had finished my -by now- very polished spiel, my boyfriend and I decided to eat there that night! And who should we see in the line up while we were leaving but the couple!I told them I would hope they enjoy their meal, but I knew they would so I just told them to get the special of the day braised beef ravioli instead.Besides the incredible pasta they also have a kick ass white sangria. I highly recommend and guarantee you'll become as much of an addict of this place as I am. Just can't beat dat garlic buttah!Quality for a great price and definitely not a tourist trap, L'Usine de Spaghetti is sure to become your cozy refuge from anything in life like it was that winter day for me.
Great food. Spaghetti St. Leonard was super delicious!! Good service. Salad bar could be better. Was very limited but it was included.
5 stars because my lamb shank fettuccine made me cry, so good! Lovell restaurant and lovely staff. And generous with bread, came with home made herb butter. Tres bon!

Read carefully!! The food was great!! My food was awesome!! Again, Food gets 5 stars!!!! However, the service SUCKED!!Our waitress was just not good. She tried to do nothing but upgrade us. No drink refills. After we got our food she was gone!!
environment is good, food is wonderful, and the price is comparable. My dad love it, will come back.
Awesome food and the service was great. They were able to accommodate us last minute although we didn't had a reservation. We'll definitely visit them again when we will be back in Montreal.

I definitely would recommend this place again. The open appetizer bar, which consists of different types of salads, was all you can eat and tempting to eat more than you should before your main entree. But make sure to save room for the entree because they are all delicious. This place was recommended to us by two strangers from Montreal and they did a good job because the pasta is super good and tasty. Everything from the presentation to licking the last bit of sauce out of the bowl was very enjoyable.

Overpriced bad food. Even the presentation was bad. Two stars for the ambiance and for being open on New Year's Day. Tasted like a microwave dinner- some parts of my meal were very hot and some bits were cold.

Not impressed. Even though wine is very good. Wide selection at a fair price. I was expecting an amazing meal but did not happen. Quickly the place got packed so service got compromised. Salad bar is complementary, lack of choices or quality. I ordered the Chicken parmigiana. You can taste the home tomato sauce being a normal grocery store/ragu brand style like. Also ordered a traditional meat sauce spaghetti (same thing). Not real cheeses either. Tiramisu(just fine) and the half ltr. Masi Red( Lovely!) We dined two for over$80+ tip. Only thing I loved was espresso. Overall not such a good pasta experience. Not keen to go back.

Spent a lovely day in Old Port for Canada Day and decided to try this restaurant with family and friends. We were all very satisfied with our experience, loved the food!I always like having a little something with my main dish and the all you can eat salad bar and bread was perfect. There are choices that'll please anyone, from your basic greens to couscous, chick peas, potato salad and so on. I got 3 plates of it and wanted more that's how much I enjoyed it.I got their classic St Leonard spaghetti with meat sauce which was extremely flavorful and had just the right texture.My mom got the duck leg confit with caramelized onions and raisins, she must not have realized that it would be so sweet although the duck itself was succulent.We were 5 people and not one of us had food left on our plates by the end of the meal.It's a charming restaurant, great location and not overly packed. The fact that it doesn't have a terrace makes it a little bit more low key compared to other restaurants in the area but I found that perfect since that means it's easier to get a table.I would definitely go back, can't wait to try their tortellini or chicken parmesan.I would have given this place 5 stars had it included a desert or drink in the meal.
Solid 9/10. Not best food i've had in my entire life but very enjoyable satisfying and delicious! Would recommend to a friend.
Great food...Loved the lamb shank fetticuine with red wine reduction.... Wow it was so good ...five star to finger licking lamb shank

user_city: East San Jose, San Jose, CA
user_review: What a wonderful, wonderful place ! We were in Montreal for 4 nights and ended up in this place for 2 of them! The #2 and #10 items on the menu are simply phenomenal! Cant wait to go back here when we visit again!

We have had dinner here twice on our week long stay in Montreal. The lobster linguini was outstanding,as was the ravioli. Also the classic spaghetti and meatballs is zesty and yummy. Have a small slice of bread with a large helping of their special butter but be careful not to over eat. Salad bar is an eclectic blend of tastes. Be careful here too, easy to over do it with the delicious variety. I tried everything in the salad bar (small bites) but not lettuce with dressing. All was outstanding. Desert: if they have strawberry shortcake get it. It's not the American-traditional style it's WAY better. This cake (and it is a cake) is why we came back a second time but jeez the meals are wonderful!  I will tell everyone I know coming to Montreal to get lunch or dinner here!!!  Wine selection was above average. I went with the suggested wine (both evenings) and it was superb with my meal. Enjoy!!!  By the way. The servers are super nice and helpful!!!!!!!

This will sound overblown but the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had (sorry Mom). My wife had the lasagna and was equally pleased. The bread was good but not warm, which was a bit of a disappointment. Table seating was comfortable although the table next to us was extremely loud, fortunately they left shortly after we were seated.Service was friendly and quick. I'd definitely go back in a heartbeat.

Solo-traveling for the first time, eating alone here was actually a great experience. They give fresh bread with homemade garlic butter and there is a salad bar included with your meal. The service was very nice and accommodating as well. I ordered the Spaghetti Saint-Paul, which was just basic spaghetti with tomato sauce. They used angel hair pasta which I was super happy about because it's my favorite! The sauce was really spicy, I'm not sure why, but it still tasted good, especially if you like spicy food. At least the bread is there on the side to comfort your taste buds. For sure a quick, easy restaurant with good food with stop in on Rue Saint-Paul after a long day.
I enjoy my meal every time I go!! Pasta is delicious!! Very unique variety of entrees and dishes. Yummy!! If I'm in the old port and feeling pasta that's the place to go!!!
The neighborhood is so beautiful and the decor inside is really detailed. Lot's of seating and when I went it was not crazy busy. Steak & spaghetti was so good.

Just happened upon this restaurant and from the inside looks i expected an average meal.  This place was astounding in fact! I've had Italian all over the world and this place is right up there now in my top 3 which are La Forketta in Singapore and the no longer open Gionetti's in Oakbrook Hills Chicago USA.  I could go on forever about the bread, the starters, the pasta sauce and the meatballs but you really need to experience this for yourself.

Solid experience, perfect meal before continuing our trek through the brisk air back to our hotel. The place has a warm vibe, with a good balance of local flair and welcoming ambiance. The food was all good, with only minor improvements that could be made. All the entrées come with unlimited salad bar and bread. The salad bar is quite small, but it's all incredibly fresh. As for the main course, we had Le Golden Square Mile and Les Éclusiers. Bot were good, but LGSM was really good. It had the most delicious goat cheese I think I've ever had. The raviolis were melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Les Éclusiers did not suck either, with a well-rounded heat to it. The shrimp were a good size, and well cooked. The flavor and freshness were fine.  All in all, we liked the food, the portions were perfect, the service was good, and the atmosphere was lovely. We'd go again. Next time, we'd leave room for the rather handsome desserts!

what a great find in old port. tons of pasta choices to choose from and great specials. reasonable wine list. our good was great and our server was very pleasant and didn't rush us. we opted for caesar salads over the salad bar, just personal preference, I regret not even checking it out...i had the lobster linguine which was full of lobster chunks and a light cream sauce, hubby had the veal saltimbica, crisp and light not cheesy. delicious.

A racist restaurant with unhygienic food and terrible customer service forcing us to tip. I went there with my friends. We were asked to wait as there was no table available. But a group of 6  people speaking french came and they were seated way before us. Moving on , my friend had a disgusting piece of mud in his salad. When we complained wbout it the waitress took the plate away and told her she will be right back, but she never came back. We could see her talking to the mamager, they both looked at us and no one came to apologize. After a few minutes another waitress came and said she won't charge us for that dish. But she forced us to tip her and told her that it is the law in Montreal to tip. Instead of being apologetic, she was arrogant and disrespectful towards us. It completely ruined our trip. I would suggest don't go there, there are other great places to eat in Montreal. It left a bad impression in our minds about Montreal.
Food atmosphere great; however waiters picked up plates and bottles with out asking .Rushing my enjoyable meal. Rush rush

Came on a Monday night and enjoyed some great food. The salad bar is a nice touch while you wait for your entrée to arrive.  The service was friendly however they seemed to be a touch under staff thus the 4 stars instead of 5.

Horendous Service! !!  We sat in the restaurant at our table for over 40 minutes waiting to place our order. Despite asking numerous times if she could take our order,  she chose to clean the empty tables instead. Once we realized that we wouldn't be getting service anytime soon,  we politely told her that we will be leaving and even left some money for the bread we ate, at the bare minimum I was expecting an excuse or even an apology  but all we got was an "okay"  its ashame because the atmosphere seems nice and full of rich history

Though looking through other reviews on this place, I thought the service was pretty friendly! The only reason for the 4 star rating is the food was mostly really good, the wine was excellent, but it was just kind of the sauce that was a little lacking. Not super expensive either for being in Old Port, but beware it isn't a cheap meal either. Mostly a positive experience, only issue was I felt the waiter didn't come around enough to bring water or whatever I was in need of (the water glasses are pretty small, and dishes are usually pretty hot) but they were pleasant about it and have me a whole pitcher of water! Overall about a 9 out of 10 experience!
Really enjoyable Italian dishes in a great setting in Old Montreal.  The prices were reasonable for the food as well as the wine.  Very friendly staff.

I thought it was cool that Charles Dickens wrote some of his notes here for A Tale of Two Cities.  It's in a very touristy part of town which might be why it tends to be a little pricey.  I thought the atmosphere was quaint and comfy.  We came in around 2:30 in the afternoon so very few people were in there.  Service was pretty good.To start, you get free bread and garlic butter.  Then, we got free salad bar with the meal.  We did not have a ton of options at the salad bar, but they were a unique selection for someone coming from Ohio.  They also had potato salad and I always love a good potato salad.  I ordered the tortellini ($14) and my wife ordered the spaghetti ($12).  These were probably the cheapest items on the menu.  The tortellini was covered in cheese and it was exactly what I was hoping for.  Italian food is not my top choice usually so I was quite happy with what I had.  My wife really enjoyed her spaghetti especially the spicy sauce.  I thought the portions were pretty good.  After having bread, potato salad, and pasta, I was quite full and satisfied.  My wife thought I should give this place 5 stars but the price is keeping me from going above 4 stars.

Very quaint, cozy and rustic italian restaurant.  The food was very good, the portions very good.  They have a kids menu, so is a family friendly space.  Dinner comes with a salad bar and lovely dinner rolls and fresh butter with herbs.  There is a wine room on site so plenty of choices there.  There are many choices on the menu to satisfy the italian craving in you.  The service was very good.  If your looking for a nice place to unwind and have a good italian meal, this is the space.
The place was nice and comfortable, prices were very reasonable. Unfortunately, I found the lasagna was pretty terrible. Everyone else at the table enjoyed their food.

We were starving after walking old Montreal for hours under the freezing weather so we really wanted to sit down and eat! This place was perfect because they have the all you can eat salads and bread while we wait for the main course...My pesto pasta wasn't the best but it was ok.

We had a wonderful lunch here. Judith was our waitress and she was so warm and lovely. She made excellent recommendations. We had the spaghetti with lobster, today's special, and spaghetti with meatballs. Both were delicious! Great great meatballs (tasty, and very tender...meaty) and so much lobster! Nice wine as well. Desserts looked great but we were too full. An all you can eat salad bar is included with the main dishes. It was delicious! Meticulously prepared salads and dressings. A wonderful feature of this restaurant! We had potato salad, beet salad, pasta salad, Israeli couscous, crisp lettuce, and homemade coleslaw. I almost forgot! They have a Wonderful warm bread basket!!! With herbed butter. Lovely and very quaint decor...from the stone wine cellar in the main dining room, to the antique phone operators switchboard by the bathrooms. Eclectic and interesting! A great place anywhere...a standout in this touristy neighborhood.

I have been here before and enjoy the food, but the service at this restaurant was appalling. The waitress was curt and rude and rushed us out of the restaurant. Other staff members took our plates too soon and kicked us out of the place immediately after paying our bill. I am generally an easy customer and a good tipper, but this was unacceptable as a paying patron at this restaurant.

We just happened to pop into the restaurant while we were touring Olde Montreal.  We did it based on the menu and the crowd inside.  We were glad that we did as the food was good.  And our servers were great. Great value for the money.

A gem in old port Montreal. Lunch comes with a salad bar and amazing garlic butter. Mushroom penne is so good that I wonder how they cook it out of such simple ingredients. Price is reasonable for this touristy area. Service is alright but definitely great value for a yummy meal!

I give this little gem a solid 4 stars. They offer a great lunch special with a soup and salad bar included with your main. I had the braised beef ravioli that was very good. I will definitely come here again. Great cozy atmosphere, very good food and reasonable prices. What's not to love?
Best Italian food I've ever had so far. Delicious meat ravioli. Lamb chops and pesto spaghetti was amazing as well. They have a good wine selection too.

For lazy readers: Food: 6.8/10Service: 6.5/10Decoration: 7.5/10General comment: crowdy, good for kids, established since a long time, cheap for a Old Port Restaurant.Review:I went there with my pal and his friend on summer at a very touristic time of the year. On the marvelous St-Paul. E St. This must be one of the best deal and it as established a solid reputation. Set on 2 floors, the concept is pretty simple : Free Bread (with butter or Garlic Butter) and Salad Buffet with approx. 10-12 choices which is pretty decent. The menu has approx. 50 choices of fresh pasta. You will pay approx. 20-25$ dollars for the whole thing. When we were there it was really crowdy and we were on the second floor, near the kitchen. Normally I would be annoyed but the very same place, Charles Dickinson was there when he wrote his Christmas Novel. I don't think I would go back there because I'm rarely amazed by pasta restaurant. What makes me come back to a restaurant is based on: Could I do this at home without being annoyed and if the answer is: NO well i might come back. However the quality of the food is good, and the service rushed but not pushy.
Spaghetti st-Paul was a simple and well executed dish. Nice selection of beers, service was friendly. Oh and it's open in-between the hours of 230pm and 5pm unlike other places.

L'usine's quaint old building is cool and interesting, comfortable but with a cramped feeling at the same time. The bar is fairly limited, with a few decent beer and wine choices, and the salad bar is good... But I wasn't all that impressed with the "Italian" food, particularly the tomato sauce. Also, our server was distracted and a little too pre-occupied with what I assume is her beau, who was seated at the barMaybe I'm spoiled with all the great Italian food I've had over the years, but my entree here was uninspired and a bit bland. Mama Francesca's home cooking it is not

I visited this restaurant along with 2 friends, who, I must mention, LOVED their meals. However, I would be lying if I said that I thought that the meal I ate was delicious, or incredibly well seasoned. I had the opportunity to taste their plate of Tortellini au Gratin, which was not bad, though comparable to what I could have prepared at home with a package of Olivieri Tortellini and some commercial sauce. And honestly, how sad is it to eat a meal in a restaurant that you could have easily prepared at home for far less expensive, and with more expertise? Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with packaged pasta - It can even be a life saver when you are short on time. The real problem with the meal that I ordered? 1 word. Overcooked. If you are going to use some commercial pasta in your kitchen, you should at least have the decency to serve it Al Dente. At least that's my take on it. On a brighter note, I should mention, again, that both of my friends really enjoyed their meals! I guess that this restaurant fails at pleasing some people, but succeeds at charming others.

I want to give three and a half stars. Food was okay nice salad bar wonderful service. Comfortable very cute place for a family meal in old Montreal . The sauce had a spicy tang to it that I didn't like. Bathrooms were an adventure couldn't fit in one stall and I'm not big, other stall the toilet moved when you sat on it.

Lovely Italian restaurant in Vieux Montreal, different and yummy salad bar, good rolls and average pasta dishes. Meatballs disappointing but still a decent value for Montreal. Efficient service by Fanny who was charming and dressed for Halloween. Wine was average but there are no deals on wine in Canada. Overall a lovely fall evening for us.

Very affordable spot in Old Montreal - other places nearby I found to be very over-priced. There's a great selection of pasta dishes and a delicious salad bar is also included in the price. Even the bread and garlic butter brought to the table was very tasty! I had a traditional spaghetti dish and it was very filling!
I never clean my plate but here I did ! Wonderful atmosphere, delicious food, not overly expensive. Salad 'bar' was a nice & unexpected touch. Perfect dinner in Old Montreal

Not so good.  My family and I were very excited to eat here.  However,  the service was less than average and so was the food.  My son who only eats alfredo sauce had to get the gigantic adult portion because they were not flexible enough to make a kid's portion.  I offered to pay the normal upcharge, but ended paying $22 for the 10 bites he nibbled on because they added scallions on top, which I clearly stated in both French and English, no spices.  My chicken parm was dry like the desert and I am still suffering from heart burn a day later from the sauce.  My daughter ate one bite of her spaghetti with meat sauce.  My husband did like his steak, although we all ate some so he left hungry.  We did not bother with dessert, as it is stored on these low to floor case. Kinda yucky way to present desserts.  Oh, by the way,  the salad bar sucks - to be blunt.  Did not take one item.  Waste of $$$$

Decent food and service, can't complain.  This place is American-style Italian food, both on selection and portion size.  A bit on the pricey side ($15-25 for lunch); right next to Jacques Cartier Square this is more of a tourist spot than anything else.  Overall, good food and unobjectionable for entertaining groups.

So, I am conflicted here as I was taken here by some co-workers of mine who live in Montreal and the service was absolutely top-notch and the place itself was very nicely appointed and comfortable.  The issue is that none of that fills my belly and being a NY who loves his Italian, I have to weight the food heavier than the rest.  The appetizers were decent with the shrimp being the best.  The duck was a little salty.  Their sauce is meaty as one reviewer pointed out but it is way too sweet and had a pasty consistency when I dined there.  This is not how sauce or "gravy" is supposed to taste or at least what I am accustomed to.  Again, the menu, drinks, service, and the company were all fantastic and some portions of the meal were very good.  I just had an issue with the sauce and for me this is a core component of my Italian food experience.
Wandered in Old Montreal and ended up here by chance.  Meat was fatty and spaghetti overcooked.
